Salvation Ministries
(Home of Success)

Salvation Ministries started on the 13th of April 1997 at Plot 35 Birabi Street GRA Phase II Port Harcourt with 34 members: 15 males, 10 females and 9 children in attendance. Today, she has become a global church with an over-flowing crowd in her Headquarters presently located at Plot 17 Birabi Street GRA Phase II Port Harcourt, Rivers State, Nigeria and her numerous satellite churches globally as well as on the internet.

Read More...

The term of office for Salvation Ministries is to spread the gospel around the world; thereby establishing the Kingdom of God here on earth and this has resulted in establishing over 1000 satellite churches and over twenty thousand (20,000) home cell centres round the globe. In 2011, Salvation Ministries started 14 satellite churches in one day, all running five services each and gathering mammoth crowd; an epic and wonder in the history of church growth. On the 26th of January 2020, she started running Seven Services and all interpreted simultaneously in both indigenous and foreign languages such as: Igbo, Hausa, French, Spanish, Arabic, Portuguese, German, Russian, Chinese, Italian, and Dutch. She presently has well over 1,000 pastors (Full time and part time) and many missionaries assisting in fulfilling the God given mandate.

In 2001, Salvation Ministries started her television program called THE HOUR OF SALVATION on NTA channel 10 Port Harcourt with the maiden episode, “FAITH IS NOW”. Today, the program is hosted on over 50 TV stations both locally and internationally. Some of these stations include:

  • Salvation TV (Salvation TV covers  Sub-Sahara, Europe, Middle East and Asia via her satellites while the whole globe is covered via her 24/7 Internet live stream)
  • Day star USA
  • WRNN New York
  • KICC Television London
  • Inspiration Television United Kingdom
  • GOD TV

In 2002, she started a greatly sought-after radio program called “DESTINY MOULDING HOUR” which has now metamorphosed into a 24hour online radio station called SALVATION RADIO on the 22nd of January 2014; transforming the lives of millions of people all around the globe.

In August 2001, she started an indoor healing miracle program tagged “HEALING MIRACLE AND DELIVERANCE SERVICE”. This service however metamorphosed into the PORT HARCOURT MIRACLE CRUSADE in November 2003 at the ALFRED DIETE-SPIFF SPORTS COMPLEX CIVIC CENTRE MOSCOW ROAD Port Harcourt. The Port Harcourt Miracle crusade moved from Civic Centre to PORT HARCOURT LIBERATION STADIUM in 2007.  After the 2007 episode of the Port Harcourt Miracle Crusade at the Port Harcourt Liberation Stadium, it became obvious that the stadium could no longer hold the capacity crowd, the program had to be moved to the church site at Igwuruta in Port Harcourt in January 2010 and continued until 2011 and was then called NIGHT OF GLORY.

In 2012, the NIGHT OF GLORY program metamorphosed into the 5 NIGHTS OF GLORY with 49 viewing centres. In January 2018 , 5 NIGHTS OF GLORY had over 1,200 viewing centres with millions of viewing points on the internet from all over the world hooking up to be part of the global event. In January, 2019 she had several viewing Centres with millions of viewing points on the internet from all over the world hooking up to be part of the global event. While the last episode of 5 NIGHTS OF GLORY in January 2020, recorded over 110 nations with millions of viewing points on the internet from all over the the world hooking up to be part of the grand finale.

Salvation Ministries believes in reaching out to the lost at all cost. In a bid to achieving this, she organizes outreaches and other outdoor miracle programs both locally and internationally such as:

  • Maryland Miracle crusade (USA)
  • Akwa-Ibom Miracle Crusade
  • Ogoni Miracle Crusade
  • Aba Miracle Crusade
  • Calabar Miracle Crusade
  • Lagos Miracle Crusade
  • Warri Miracle Crusade
  • Campus Crusades – Rivers State University Of Science and Technology, University Of Port Harcourt , Port Harcourt Polythecnic & Yakubu Gowon Stadium.
  • Bayelsa Miracle crusade
  • Festival of Miracles Maryland
  • GLORY, POWER AND MIRACLE Crusades (ABUJA, OWERRI, ASABA)
  • Uyo Miracle Crusade
  • Nnewi Miracle Crusade
  • Asaba Miracle Crusade
  • Imo Miracle Crusade
  • Global Campus Miracle Crusade (University Of Port Harcourt, with viewing points in 19 other campuses)
  • Erie Pennsylvania Miracle Crusade (USA)

These have produced landmark testimonies.

Salvation Ministries also believes in helping the less privileged through her welfare programs and schemes namely:

  • Scholarship
  • Welfare for widows
  • Free medical outreaches
  • Gifts to orphanages and so on…

In 2016, she awarded scholarship to 634 students in primary, secondary and tertiary institutions and in 2017, over 850 students benefited in 2017 scholarship and over 2,000 students benefited in 2018 scholarship as the Commission believes that when you give a child education, you have given him/her a chance to a brighter future.

Salvation Ministries believes in contributing and impacting the society. She cannot stand the suffering of the masses. She had sent relief materials to flood victims and war torn areas such as:

  • LIBERIA
  • BAYELSA, Nigeria
  • JOS, Nigeria
  • Delta, Nigeria
  • BENUE, Nigeria and so on.

She also believes in helping the less privileged through her welfare programs and schemes namely:

  • Scholarship
  • Welfare to widows
  • Free medical outreaches
  • Gifts to orphanages and so on

In 2016, Salvation Ministries awarded scholarship to 634 students in primary, secondary and tertiary institutions and in 2017, over 850 students benefited in 2017 scholarship and over 2,000 students benefitted in 2018 scholarship as the Commission believes that when you give a child education, you have given him/her a chance to a brighter future. She also reconstructed several roads in the city of Port Harcourt for easy mobility and to make the environment more habitable. She is seriously involved in community services and regular environmental clean-up exercises. Committed to building a caring and loving Society, furnished with dignity and harmony, Salvation Ministries renovated and donated modern hospital equipment worth over two hundred thousand U.S Dollars to the pediatric section of the University of Port Harcourt Teaching Hospital (UPTH) Nigeria; creating a wonderful ambiance to expedite the recovery of the patients.

In 2017, Salvation Ministries built a home for the elderly in Port Harcourt equipped with the state of the art facilities that will suit the personal needs of the senior citizens who require some assistance with daily activities and health care; so they can age with dignity. The presiding pastor of the Commission, GOD’s servant, David Ibiyeomie was born in Bonny Island, Rivers State, Nigeria. He is blessed with unusual divine speed. He became born again in 1995 and went to BIBLE SCHOOL that same year. Two years after, on Sunday April 13th 1997, with 34 persons in attendance and the mandate TO ESTABLISH THE KINGDOM OF GOD HERE ON EARTH through infallible proofs, David Ibiyeomie started Salvation Ministries, the Home of Success; now one of the fastest growing churches in the world.

Salvation Ministries has published over 97 books authored by both the presiding pastor David Ibiyeomie and his lovely wife, Pst. Mrs. Peace Ibiyeomie; with best sellers such as;

Salvation Ministries also impacts the society through rehabilitation of roads, skill acquisition for the unemployed, all-expense paid rehabilitation exercise for militants, awarding of scholarship for the underprivileged and provision of food supplies and relief materials for victims of natural disaster, donation of modern hospital equipment worth hundreds of thousands to the pediatric section of the University of Port Harcourt Teaching Hospital [UPTH] Nigeria in order to create a wonderful ambiance to expedite the recovery of little children and donation of fully constructed/fully furnished home for the elderly to the Catholic Church to suit the personal needs of the senior citizens so they can age with grace and dignity. These are few of Salvation Ministries’ philanthropic work geared towards making the society a better place. Salvation Ministries undertakes giant projects like building a mega cathedral that runs into millions of dollars, acquiring over 200 Hectares of land for the university project and constructing all at once without any foreign aid, bank loan or financial pressure. The ministry also has an educational arm, Chokhmah International Academy for primary and secondary school while the University arm is currently under construction.
